sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Hey everyone, Jihad Al Sayed here! Today we’re diving into the characteristic equation — the key to unlocking eigenvalues and understanding matrix behavior.

sections.title: What Is the Characteristic Equation?
sections.content: It's the equation you get from det(A - λI) = 0. The solutions are the eigenvalues of A. This equation transforms the matrix into a polynomial.

sections.title: Why Determinant Matters
sections.math: \text{det}(A - \lambda I) = 0 → \text{This gives a polynomial equation in } \lambda

sections.title: Applications
sections.content: The characteristic equation is used to analyze system stability, solve differential equations, and in principal component analysis (PCA).

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We broke down what the characteristic equation is, how to compute it, and why it’s your first step in finding eigenvalues.
